title: 111_hr130
content: The Act is titled the "Los Padres National Forest Land Exchange Act" and involves a land exchange in Los Padres National Forest, California. The "Los Padres National Forest Land Exchange Act" involves a land exchange between the United Water Conservation District of California and the Secretary of Agriculture for National Forest System lands. The District will convey approximately 340 acres of land in San Bernardino base and meridian, while the Secretary will convey National Forest System lands subject to certain conditions. The National Forest System lands to be conveyed by the Secretary consist of approximately 440 acres located within township 5 north, range 18 west, San Bernardino base and meridian. Tracts include various sections totaling different acreages. The National Forest System lands to be conveyed consist of approximately 440 acres in township 5 north, range 18 west, San Bernardino base and meridian. Tracts include different sections totaling various acreages, such as 5, 2.5, and 10 acres in different configurations. Tracts 16 to 22, ranging from 2.5 to 80 acres, are part of a land exchange in Los Padres National Forest. Maps showing the exchange lands are available for public inspection. The Secretary may correct errors in maps or legal descriptions for the land exchange. The number of tracts or legal descriptions can be adjusted by mutual agreement. The completion of the land exchange is a priority for the Forest Service, aiming to finish within one year. Administrative costs for the exchange will be incurred. The land exchange must be completed within one year of the enactment of the Act. Administrative costs, including survey, mapping, appraisals, and recording fees, will be shared equally between the District and the Secretary. The Secretary will ensure that title standards for acquired lands are in conformity with the Attorney General's standards. Easements for necessary roads and trails will be reserved in the conveyance of National Forest System lands. The Secretary will reserve easements for roads and trails for administrative purposes and public access to National Forest System lands. The District must construct a gravel parking area for access to the Potholes trail, subject to Secretary approval. Public lands withdrawals from previous acts may be partially revoked. The withdrawals provided by previous acts affecting National Forest System lands are revoked. The land exchange does not include water rights. The exchange will be conducted on an equal value basis, with the option to equalize values through a cash payment exceeding statutory limits. The cash equalization payment received by the Secretary under this section will be deposited into a fund for the Los Padres National Forest in California. The boundaries of the forest will be adjusted as a result of the land exchange. The boundaries of the Los Padres National Forest will be adjusted as a result of a land exchange, with District lands added to and administered as part of the forest in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
